DOC.brief_summary: The purpose parallel design study assess relative effect two 12-week healthy eat dietary intervention : general healthy eating ( Diet A ) general healthy eating combine advice increase fibre intake ( Diet B ) least 25g/day ( large proportion fibre intake derive cereal wheat bran ) , overweight low-fibre consuming premenopausal female adult body weight change ( kg ) . It hypothesize add fibre healthy eat diet ( Diet B ) would lead great weight loss and/or weight loss maintenance follow healthy eat diet alone ( Diet A ) .
DOC.brief_title: The Leeds Women 's Wellbeing ( LWW ) Study
DOC.detailed_description: In randomise , single blind , parallel design study participant randomly assign one two 12-week healthy eat dietary intervention : Diet A : general healthy eating OR Diet B : general healthy eating combine advice increase fibre intake least 25g/day ( large proportion fibre intake derive cereal wheat bran .
DOC.criteria: Female 1848 year age ( premenopausal ) Self report good health Body Mass Index ( BMI ) within overweight/obese range ( 2635kg/m2 ) Willingness consume study food prepare eat breakfast cereal part intervention Nonsmokers give 6 month ago Exercising 4 time per week medium intensity Weight stable last 3 month ( fluctuation 3kg ) Current fibre intake ( â‰¤ 15g/day ) accord DINE verify 7 day food diary ( fibre point ) Ability adequately understand verbal write information English Menopausal show menopausal symptom ( e.g . frequent/recurrent hot flush ) screen take supplement menopausal symptom Type 2 Diabetes ; Cardiac pacemaker fit Taking medication and/or supplement know affect appetite/body weight last 6 month ( e.g . asthma , steroid , antidepressant ) BMI outside range 2635 kg/m2 Food allergy aversion food likely consume within study ( e.g . wheat bran , nut ) Nonsmokers give 6 month ago Exercising 4 time per week medium intensity Shift work ( night shift ) Pregnant planning pregnancy within next year ; pregnant lactating within previous 6 month No history , current eating disorder determine use Eating Attitudes Test ( EAT26 ; Gardner et al. , 1982 ; score high 20 ) Current fibre intake ( > 15g/day accord DINE ) Insufficient English language skill complete study questionnaire
